Mathar_, Nov 21 2011This sequence can be generated by an infinite number of formulas all having the form a^(b*n) mod c subject to the following conditions. The number a can be congruent to either 2,3, or 4 mod 5 (A047202). If a is congruent to 2 or 3 mod 5, then b can be any number of the form 4k+2 and c = 5 or 15. If a is congruent to 4 mod 5, then b can be any number of the form  2k+1 and c = 5.  For example: a(n) = 29^(13*n) mod 5,  a(n) = 24^(11*n) mod 5, and a(n) = 22^(10*n) mod 15. - _Gary Detlefs_, May 19 2014
